intro: Strobilanthes lanyuensis, commonly known as Lanyu's flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests, where it thrives in the cool, humid climate. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
